description: From un- +‎ gird; or possibly continuing Middle English ungirden, ungurden, from Old English ungyrdan (“to ungird”). Cognate with German entgürten (“to ungird”).

verbs.description: ungird (third-person singular simple present ungirds, present participle ungirding, simple past and past participle ungirded)

entries.meaning: To loosen the girdle or band of.
